body.para: the easiest would be to have only one account and set up filters to label messages based on who they came from.

grouping messages goes by using labels: There are labels in Gmail, not folders. Labels are better because they save space in your account. This means that you will only have ONLY ONE copy of your email even if you attach several labels to it. Labels are like post-it notes on a document - you have only one document but you can put many post-it notes on it. The same is true for labels.

So if you want to remove a labelled message from xour inbox, DO NOT delete it! Select it and click on "Archive". This will move your email to "All mail". You can find it there or under the label(s) you attached. To make labelling automatic, you can set up filters to sort your incoming messages.
For more info read: labels: https://mail.google.com/support/bin/topic.py?topic=12845 filters: https://mail.google.com/support/bin/topic.py?topic=12853
